alert.note: Alert for Central Yampa River Basin; Lower Yampa River Basin (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 01 at 11:43PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Moffat County through 1230 AM MDT... At 1142 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 44 miles northeast of Dinosaur, or 56 miles west of Craig, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Moffat County, including the following locations... Powder Wash and Sparks. This includes Colorado 318 between mile markers 25 and 31. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Yampa River Basin; Lower Yampa River Basin
